image.altText: An office building facing a suburban road.

props.synopsis: An investigation is underway into the handling of grant funding by past management at one of South Australia's largest disability advocacy services.

title.children: Disability advocacy service under investigation, clients told to 'represent yourself'

image.altText: Lady with long brown hair, black dress and yellow rainbow earrings stares somber at the camera with a child memorial behind

props.synopsis: When Bronwyn Helgeson's five-year-old son died suddenly, she was left dealing with unimaginable grief and unexpected financial costs.

title.children: Australia 'behind the game' with helping families navigate child loss

image.altText: A man with grey hair and moustache lays in a hospital bed with a woman leaning down with her arm around him

props.synopsis: SA Health officials apologise to a man who waited 15 hours to be seen at an Adelaide emergency department after presenting with a suspected stroke.

title.children: 'It was awful': Man waits 15 hours in Adelaide hospital after suspected stroke

image.altText: Lauren Willgoose walks alongside an older woman outside the court

props.synopsis: A former Adelaide lawyer who drank more than a litre of wine before fatally crashing into a pedestrian has been jailed for eight years.

title.children: Former lawyer jailed over hit-run that killed pedestrian

image.altText: The mangled remains of a freight train after a crash with a truck in the outback.

props.synopsis: Mick Warren and Kevin Baker died on New Year's Eve 2023 when their train collided with a truck at a level crossing near the SA-NSW border.

title.children: Truck driver pleads not guilty over deadly crash with freight train

image.altText: Man in red hat stands in spiral staircase

props.synopsis: After decades of cultural division over the date chosen to celebrate Australia Day, hip hop artist Rulla Kelly-Mansell proposes a different date that marks one of the most unifying moments in the country's history.

title.children: Rapper's quest to 'find the date' prompts bold proposal for Australia Day

image.altText: Calcified tree roots in a cave.

props.synopsis: The Munro Karst system in South Australia's south-east could be 2 million years old and may contain rare fossils.

title.children: Push to have ancient cave system added to SA heritage list

image.altText: An aerial view of a small dried out lake in a field.

props.synopsis: Adelaide Hills resident Jodie Burr usually buys one tank of water a year. Since November, she's bought 10 and will have to wait eight weeks for her next delivery.

title.children: Water shortages leave Adelaide Hills farmers and householders 'at breaking point'

image.altText: A fire burns in a national park, aerial shot

props.synopsis: Around 30 per cent of Mount Remarkable National Park has been gutted but, miraculously, the CFS believes no wildlife was hurt. It would have been a different story a decade ago.

title.children: Flinders Ranges bushfire controlled after destroying more than 5,000ha

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja at South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

props.synopsis: SA Police has told the Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence, victims will wait longer for background checks on abusive partners without additional government funding.

title.children: DV victims to wait longer for background checks in SA, police call for more funding

image.altText: A man points while two other men watch on

props.synopsis: In a fiery speech filled with heckling and recriminations, Donald Trump defended his second term agenda and urged Americans bear with "a little disturbance" from his economic policies. These were the big moments of his address to a joint session of congress.

title.children: A fiery Trump spars with hecklers, speaks on Greenland, and shouts out Musk

image.altText: A house after being hit by a shell, partially destroyed in a Ukrainian town.

props.synopsis: CIA director John Ratcliffe says the move will "put the world in a better place for these peace negotiations to move forward", with the move coming amid deteriorating relations between Washington DC and Kyiv.

title.children: Trump administration cuts off intelligence sharing with Ukraine

image.altText: a person holding a phone with a search bar showing cyclone alfred and a page about climate science

props.synopsis: Despite hundreds of thousands of accounts talking about Cyclone Alfred on Facebook, social media giant Meta was blocking or hiding search results about the impending storm before being contacted by ABC NEWS Verify.

title.children: Facebook denies intentionally blocking searches for Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: Port Augusta courts building

props.synopsis: A South Australian judge says the Department for Child Protection failed to remove a child who was being criminally neglected by her mother despite observing the toddler in "urine-soaked" clothing.

title.children: Mother sentenced after leaving toddler in dirty nappy for days

image.altText: David Speirs is flanked by journalists and cameras outside the Adelaide Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: Negotiations between prosecutors and lawyers for former South Australian opposition leader David Speirs are underway, as his drugs charges are confirmed in court.

title.children: Drugs charges to proceed against former SA opposition leader

image.altText: Meghan smiles as she looks to the camera in a white kitchen wearing a pastel floral blouse.

props.synopsis: Meghan's mindful lifestyle show is all about finding the joy in the little things. Of course it isn't groundbreaking. But it is the definition of an easy watch.

title.children: The world was ready to hate Meghan's new show. Was it right to?

image.altText: A woman standing under an outdoor patio of a raised house

props.synopsis: South East Queensland's islands will be the first pieces of land to bear the impacts of Tropical Cyclone Alfred. Many of its residents are evacuating and heading west.

title.children: 'It's a lottery': Island residents the first to feel the impact of Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: a sunset or sunrise on the horizon with broken sea ice below nd clouds above

props.synopsis: Scientists have found it difficult to capture longer-term changes to Antarctic sea ice as satellite records date from 45 years ago, but a recent reconstruction winds the record back to 1899.

title.children: 'What's alarming is how we're not alarmed anymore': Sea ice drops again

image.altText: An early morning shot of the rubble of a war-damaged apartment

props.synopsis: Arab leaders have endorsed Egypt's postwar plan for the Gaza Strip in a counterproposal to US President Donald Trump's plan to redevelop the region as a beach destination.

title.children: Arab leaders endorse Egypt's plan to rebuild Gaza

image.altText: A man looking away from the camera

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering Queensland woman Toyah Cordingley had asked his wife for a divorce several months before he abruptly left his family, a court has heard.

title.children: Wife of murder accused breaks down in tears in Toyah Cordingley case

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A large group of people crowd around a pile of sand as they fil sandbags with shovels

props.synopsis: Calm but tense scenes are playing out across south-east Queensland as residents brace for Tropical Cyclone Alfred’s arrival.

title.children: 'You can only do what you can do': Bracing for Alfred's arrival

image.altText: Two grey fighter jets fly side-by-side against a blue and lightly cloudy sky

props.synopsis: The Philippine jet was engaged on a mission to help fight communist guerilla fighters in the country's south when it lost contact.

title.children: Mystery surrounds Philippines fighter jet crash that killed two pilots

image.altText: A crowd of people shopping in Pitt St Mall, Sydney.

props.synopsis: The HILDA report is a body of work that has surveyed 9,000 Australian households every year, for the last 22 years. Here's what they say has changed.

title.children: New report shows how Australian life has changed over last 20 years

image.altText: Steve Smith directing his field against Afghanistan

props.synopsis: Steve Smith announces his retirement from one-day international cricket, following Australia's exit from the ICC Champions Trophy.

title.children: Steve Smith announces retirement from ODI cricket

image.altText: A locked gate with a large 'no unauthorised entry' sign affixed to it.

props.synopsis: The company operating the Northern Territory's McArthur River Mine, one of the world's largest lead and zinc mines, has been convicted and fined for unlawful works on a sacred site spanning 13 years.

title.children: Massive Australian mine fined for illegally working on Aboriginal sacred site

image.altText: Police tape cordons off a house in a suburban area.

props.synopsis: Anthony Coulter Wright was told by the court that his actions had caused "excruciating and ongoing grief" to his wife's loved ones, including the children they shared.

title.children: Queensland man gets life sentence for murdering wife of 30 years

image.altText: A fire engine and truck with men in high vis gear on a road next to the bush

props.synopsis: Police allege a man charged with murdering four people had engaged in a targeted attack when he followed a car in an attempted robbery on the NSW north coast a year ago.

title.children: 'Targeted attack': Man charged with four counts of murder after crash

image.altText: An adult female varroa destructor mite.

props.synopsis: Varroa destructor mite has been found in southern Queensland, the first detection of the world's worst bee-killing parasite in the state.

title.children: World's worst bee-killing parasite found in Queensland

image.altText: A composite image of Donald Trump and solar panels.

props.synopsis: What Macquarie's departure from a global green alliance committed to cutting emissions tells us about the future of net zero finance.

title.children: Macquarie follows major US banks out the door of climate alliance

image.altText: A woman carrying shopping bags.

props.synopsis: Australia's economy rebounds in the December quarter, with the annual rate of growth lifting to 1.3 per cent.

title.children: Australia's economy exits 21-month per capita recession

image.altText: The outside of a mosque building with a sign for prayer.

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy from WA is charged after allegedly making violent threats against a mosque in Sydney.

title.children: Parents of WA teen who allegedly threatened Sydney mosque 'horrified'

image.altText: A bold man in black top gestures while he is speaking

props.synopsis: Self-described misogynist influencer Andrew Tate and his brother have denied raping and human trafficking allegations in Romania, saying they were "largely misunderstood".

title.children: Tate brothers hit with US criminal investigation after landing in Florida

image.altText: erence Stamp, Guy Pearce, and Hugo Weaving dazzle in the outback in Priscilla, Queen of the Desert.

props.synopsis: Drag Race star Etcetera Etcetera and legendary queen Cindy Pastel reflect on the history of the art form in Australia.

title.children: How the real person behind Priscilla Queen of the Desert became in icon
